intro: Cissampelos pareira var. zairensis, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces fleshy, red berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in traditional medicine and ecological studies.
